skill.name: fresh-eyes-review
skill.description: This skill should be used as a mandatory final sanity check before git commit, PR creation, or declaring work done. Triggers on "commit", "push", "PR", "pull request", "done", "finished", "complete", "ship", "deploy", "ready to merge". Catches security vulnerabilities, logic errors, and business rule bugs that slip through despite passing tests.
skill.summary: This skill should be used as a mandatory final sanity check before git commit, PR creation, or decla...
skill.author: 2389-research

security_audit.summary: This is a pure markdown documentation skill with no executable code. All static findings are false positives triggered by educational example code snippets demonstrating vulnerabilities and their fixes. The skill provides security review guidance and checklists. No actual security risks present.

content.value_statement: Critical bugs often escape despite passing tests. This skill enforces a mandatory final quality gate that catches security vulnerabilities, logic errors, and business rule bugs before code ships.
actual_capabilities: Systematic security vulnerability checks (SQL injection, XSS, path traversal, command injection)
Logic error detection (off-by-one, race conditions, null handling, type coercion)
Business rule validation (calculations, conditions, edge cases, error messages)
Performance issue identification (N+1 queries, unbounded loops, memory leaks)
Mandatory announcement and results reporting workflow
Immediate fix verification with test re-runs
limitations: This skill provides guidance only. The AI must apply the checklist to actual code changes.
Does not execute tests or static analysis tools directly.
Relies on the AI to properly identify issues based on the code it reviews.
Cannot catch bugs in code that has already been merged or deployed.

use_cases.title: Pre-commit safety check
use_cases.description: Run a systematic review before every git commit to catch issues that tests miss.

use_cases.title: PR quality gate
use_cases.description: Apply a structured checklist before approving pull requests to ensure thorough coverage.

use_cases.title: Security vulnerability catch
use_cases.description: Detect common security issues like injection attacks and auth bypass before deployment.

prompt_templates.title: Basic pre-commit review
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm ready to commit my changes. Please run the fresh-eyes review on the modified files.

prompt_templates.title: PR readiness check
prompt_templates.prompt: I'm done with this feature and ready to create a PR. Perform a fresh-eyes review first.

prompt_templates.title: Feature completion review
prompt_templates.prompt: I've finished implementing the feature. Run fresh-eyes review before I consider this done.

prompt_templates.title: Deployment safety check
prompt_templates.prompt: About to deploy to production. Please do a fresh-eyes review of all changed files first.

output_examples.input: I'm done implementing the auth feature, let me commit
output: Starting fresh-eyes review of 4 files. This will take 2-5 minutes.
[Reviews auth.ts for security] Found: Missing input validation on email field. Fixed: Added email format validation.
[Reviews handler.ts for logic] Found: Off-by-one error in pagination. Fixed: Changed < to <= in boundary check.
[Reviews db.ts for performance] No issues found.
[Reviews api.ts for business rules] No issues found.
Fresh-eyes complete. 2 issues found and fixed.

best_practices: Always trigger this skill before git commit, PR creation, or declaring work done.
Announce the file count and expected duration to create accountability.
Fix issues immediately and re-run tests before proceeding.
Declare results even when zero issues are found to prove execution.
anti_patterns: Skipping the review because tests pass or because you're confident the code is correct.
Rushing through in under 2 minutes, which suggests insufficient review depth.
Ignoring the review because a partner is waiting or production is blocked.
Assuming senior approval means the implementation details were thoroughly reviewed.

faq.question: Does this skill work with all programming languages?
faq.answer: Yes. The security, logic, and business rule checklists are language-agnostic and apply to any codebase.

faq.question: How long does a fresh-eyes review take?
faq.answer: Plan for 2-5 minutes depending on file count. Faster reviews may indicate insufficient depth.

faq.question: Does this integrate with my existing CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill. It does not modify CI/CD configs but can run before git operations.

faq.question: Is my code data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. The skill only reviews code locally. No data is transmitted to external services.

faq.question: What if the skill finds issues that require larger refactoring?
faq.answer: Fix issues immediately as the skill directs. Larger refactoring may need separate planning and testing.

faq.question: How is this different from automated code analysis tools?
faq.answer: This skill catches issues that automated tools miss, such as business rule bugs and logic errors that depend on context.
